description: Advanced battle tactics for Castle Battles, Foundry Clash, Frostfire Mine, and other competitive events

castle_battles.name: Castle Battles / Facility Battles
castle_battles.description: Tactics for attacking and defending facilities like Sunfire Castle, Bear Trap buildings, and SvS facilities
castle_battles.overview: Castle battles are won through coordination, timing, and overwhelming force. A well-timed double rally beats a stronger garrison every time.

double_rally.name: Double Rally (Synchronized Strike)
double_rally.description: Two rallies timed to hit the exact same second, overwhelming even strong garrisons
how_it_works: Two rally leaders start rallies against the same target
Coordinate countdown so both rallies LAND at the exact same time
Garrison can only defend against one rally at a time
Second rally hits while garrison is still fighting first rally
Combined damage often wipes garrison that could handle either rally alone
execution_tips: Use voice chat (Discord) for precise countdown
Account for march time differences - farther leader starts first
Standard countdown: '3... 2... 1... GO' on rally launch
Both leaders should have similar march speeds
Practice with alliance before important battles
double_rally.why_effective: A garrison of 2M troops might beat a 1.5M rally, but two 1.5M rallies hitting simultaneously = 3M attackers vs 2M defenders. The math changes completely.
common_mistakes: Starting rallies at same time instead of timing ARRIVAL
Not accounting for different march speeds
Poor communication leading to 5-10 second gaps

post_rally_swarm.name: Post-Rally Troop Swarm
post_rally_swarm.description: Individual attacks timed to arrive immediately after double rally, before enemy can reinforce
how_it_works: Double rally wipes or heavily damages garrison
Pre-staged individual marches arrive 1-5 seconds after rally lands
These 'cleanup' attacks hit the weakened/empty facility
Enemy has no time to send new garrison troops
Facility flips to your alliance before reinforcements arrive
execution_tips: Have 5-10 players stage attacks timed to land RIGHT after rally
Use faster march speeds or closer positions
Stagger arrivals by 1-2 seconds to maintain pressure
First individual attack should aim to land within 3 seconds of rally
Keep sending waves until facility is secured
post_rally_swarm.timing_window: You typically have 10-30 seconds before enemy can react and send new garrison. Use this window aggressively.

garrison_sandwich.name: Garrison Sandwich
garrison_sandwich.description: Time reinforcement troops to arrive between double rally hits
how_it_works: First rally hits and engages garrison
Individual troop marches arrive DURING the battle
Second rally hits while garrison is split/engaged
Reinforcement troops add to attacking power mid-battle
garrison_sandwich.advanced_note: This requires very precise timing and is harder to execute than standard double rally. Use only with experienced coordinators.

rally_chain.name: Rally Chain (Sustained Pressure)
rally_chain.description: Multiple rallies hitting in sequence to maintain constant pressure
how_it_works: Rally 1 hits, damages garrison
Rally 2 hits 30-60 seconds later on weakened garrison
Rally 3 follows up if needed
Enemy cannot rebuild garrison between hits
when_to_use: When you have more rally leaders than enemy has garrison capacity
When double rally alone isn't enough

feint_rally.name: Feint Rally (Bait and Switch)
feint_rally.description: Start a rally to draw garrison, then cancel and hit real target
how_it_works: Start rally against decoy target (visible to enemy)
Enemy moves garrison troops to defend
Cancel rally at last moment
Immediately double rally the REAL target (now undefended)
feint_rally.risks: Enemy may call your bluff. Only works against reactive defenders.

garrison_rotation.name: Garrison Rotation
garrison_rotation.description: Keeping fresh troops in garrison at all times
how_it_works: Assign garrison slots to specific players
When rally is incoming, garrison commander calls for reinforcements
Fresh troops replace wounded troops immediately after battle
Never leave garrison empty or below capacity
tips: Use highest troop count players for garrison
Rotate between battles to spread healing costs

counter_timing.name: Counter-Timing
counter_timing.description: Sending garrison troops timed to arrive DURING enemy rally
how_it_works: Watch incoming rally timer
Calculate when your troops will arrive
Send reinforcements timed to land DURING the battle
Your fresh troops join mid-fight, turning the tide
counter_timing.math: A 2M garrison fighting a 3M rally is losing. But 500K fresh troops arriving mid-battle can swing it back.

anti_swarm.name: Anti-Swarm Protocol
how_it_works: Immediately after surviving a rally, flood garrison with troops
Don't wait to see if more attacks are coming
Multiple players send small reinforcements simultaneously
Overwhelm the 'cleanup' attacks with numbers
anti_swarm.key_insight: Enemy expects you to be slow. React in under 5 seconds to deny their swarm.

coordination_requirements.voice_chat: Discord or similar - text chat is too slow for precise timing
coordination_requirements.rally_leaders: Need 2+ strong rally leaders for double rally
coordination_requirements.scout_reports: Know enemy garrison strength before attacking
coordination_requirements.march_calculators: Know exact march times for coordination
coordination_requirements.backup_plans: Have Plan B if double rally fails

common_mistakes.mistake: Launching rallies at the same TIME instead of timing ARRIVAL
common_mistakes.correction: Account for different march distances. Farther rally starts first so both LAND together.

common_mistakes.mistake: No follow-up after successful double rally
common_mistakes.correction: Have players staged to send individual attacks immediately. Don't give enemy time to react.

common_mistakes.mistake: Garrison is empty after a battle
common_mistakes.correction: Assign backup garrison players. Fresh troops should arrive within 5-10 seconds of battle ending.
Always scout first. Know if you need double rally or triple rally based on garrison strength.

common_mistakes.mistake: Using text chat for timing coordination
common_mistakes.correction: Voice chat only for double rallies. The 2-3 second delay in text can ruin timing.

double_rally_checklist: Both rally leaders ready with full troops
March times calculated for simultaneous arrival

foundry.name: Foundry Clash (Foundry Battle)
foundry.description: Biweekly Alliance-vs-Alliance event fighting for control of an imperial weapons foundry
foundry.overview: A 60-minute strategic battle where alliances compete to capture buildings and accumulate Arsenal Points. Buildings generate points over time when controlled.

event_basics.team_size: Up to 2 Legions (30 combatants + 10 substitutes each = 80 total)

requirements.timing: Must join alliance BEFORE registration closes

event_basics.key_mechanic: Troops don't die - all casualties are injuries only, automatic healing after battle

phase_1.priority: Secure Transit Station FIRST (50% teleport cooldown reduction)

phase_2.priority: Imperial Foundry is highest value target

imperial_foundry.note: Highest value target in the event

phase_1_strategy.name: Phase 1 Opening
steps: Rush Transit Station immediately (50% teleport CD is huge)
Capture Boiler Room (faster building captures)
Control Prototype Sites for early points
Establish defensive positions

phase_2_strategy.name: Phase 2 Push
steps: Send strongest troops to Imperial Foundry
Use coordinated double rallies (time ARRIVALS, not launches)
Control Munitions Warehouse for damage bonus
Deploy Mercenary Camp strike teams

phase_3_strategy.name: Phase 3 Cleanup
steps: Hunt Weapon Workshops (great F2P opportunity)
Maintain control of high-value buildings
If trailing, target unguarded neutral sites
Final push with maximum point accumulation

point_looting.name: Point Scattering Mechanic
point_looting.description: When enemies lose buildings, 50% of accumulated points scatter as lootable supplies
point_looting.tip: Watch the mini-map for yellow dots - these are free points!

smart_recovery.name: 12-Minute Reset
smart_recovery.description: Leave battlefield for 12 minutes for full heal instead of using speedups
smart_recovery.when_to_use: When not in critical battle phase

f2p.focus: Target low-contest areas; gather Weapon Workshops; reinforce stronger allies

mid_spender.focus: Join whale-led rallies; support defense; capture secondary buildings

whale.focus: Lead aggressive captures; control Imperial Foundry; organize mass rallies

distribution.alliance_ranking: Based on Legion 1's final Point Ranking
distribution.personal_merit: Based on individual Arsenal Point ranking

common_mistakes.correction: 50% teleport cooldown is MASSIVE. Secure it immediately.

common_mistakes.mistake: Solo attacking instead of coordinating rallies
common_mistakes.correction: Always coordinate with alliance. Double rallies beat single attacks.

common_mistakes.mistake: Launching rallies simultaneously instead of timing arrivals
common_mistakes.correction: Time ARRIVALS, not launch times. Farther player starts first.
Maintain 4-5 player garrisons on controlled buildings.
50% of points scatter when buildings are lost. Collect them!
Use 12-minute leave for full free heal when possible.
Great F2P opportunity - these spawn randomly and give good points.
Assign one person to coordinate all movements via voice chat.

pre_battle_checklist: VIP, tech, Chief Gear buffs active
phase_priorities: Phase 1: Transit Station > Boiler Room > Prototype Sites
Phase 2: Imperial Foundry > Munitions Warehouse > Mercenary Camp
Phase 3: Weapon Workshops > Defend holdings > Target unguarded buildings

bear_trap.name: Bear Trap (Bear Hunt)
bear_trap.description: Alliance rally event where you hunt bears for valuable rewards including pet fragments and essence stones
bear_trap.overview: Bear Trap is an S-Tier event that should NEVER be skipped. Your alliance rallies against powerful bears using expedition skills. Proper troop composition and hero selection are critical for success.

event_basics.skill_type: EXPEDITION skills (top-right) are used, NOT exploration skills
event_basics.rally_system: Leader's 3 heroes use their expedition skills, plus top 4 highest-LEVEL skills from all joiners

leader_contribution.description: Rally leader's 3 deployed heroes contribute their expedition skills
leader_contribution.note: Place your STRONGEST expedition skill hero in leftmost slot

joiner_contribution.description: Only the leftmost hero's TOP-RIGHT expedition skill is considered from each joiner
joiner_contribution.selection: System picks top 4 highest LEVEL skills from all joiners combined
joiner_contribution.tip: Level matters more than the skill itself - a level 5 mediocre skill beats a level 1 great skill

troop_composition.why_marksman: Bears are weak to ranged damage. Marksman troops deal significantly more damage to bears.
troop_composition.common_mistake: Using balanced 33/33/33 composition wastes damage potential

best_joiners.note: Highest damage boost available for rallies

heroes_to_avoid.reason: His expedition skill is DEFENSIVE (-20% damage taken). Great for garrison defense, USELESS for attack rallies.
heroes_to_avoid.common_mistake: Many players put Sergey in attack rallies thinking he's universally good

hero_selection.slot_placement: Strongest expedition skill hero goes in LEFTMOST slot - only that skill is counted from joiners

as_leader.name: Rally Leader Strategy
steps: Fill rally with 80-90% Marksman troops
Place 3 heroes with strongest EXPEDITION (not exploration) skills
Leftmost hero should have best single expedition skill
Wait for rally to fill before launching
Communicate rally timing with alliance

as_joiner.name: Rally Joiner Strategy
steps: Put hero with best expedition skill in LEFTMOST slot
Level up your expedition skills - level matters most
Join with high troop count (more troops = more damage)
Jessie is almost always the best choice for leftmost slot
If you don't have Jessie, use Jasser/Seo-yoon/Jeronimo

alliance_coordination.name: Alliance-Wide Strategy
steps: Assign dedicated rally leaders (strongest players)
Coordinate rally times so members can join
Focus on highest level bears for best rewards
Don't waste rallies on low-level bears
Track who has Jessie for optimal joiner placement

rewards.tip: Always target highest level bear your alliance can reliably defeat

common_mistakes.correction: Sergey's expedition skill is DEFENSIVE. Use offensive heroes like Jessie, Jasser, Jeronimo.

common_mistakes.mistake: Putting wrong hero in leftmost slot as joiner
common_mistakes.correction: Only leftmost hero's expedition skill counts. Put your best expedition skill there.
80-90% Marksman is optimal for bear damage.
Bear Trap uses EXPEDITION (top-right) skills, NOT exploration skills.
Level your expedition skills! A level 5 skill beats a level 1 skill regardless of effect.

common_mistakes.mistake: Starting rallies without waiting for joiners
common_mistakes.correction: Wait for rally to fill - more joiners = more damage + more top skills selected.
Focus on highest level bears for best rewards per rally.

joiner_checklist: Leftmost hero has best expedition skill (Jessie if you have her)
All skills are highest level possible

frostfire_mine.name: Frostfire Mine
frostfire_mine.description: Competitive 30-minute mining battle for Orichalcum with PvP elements
frostfire_mine.overview: Players compete to gather Orichalcum by occupying veins, defeating patrol guards, and engaging in PvP. NO TROOP LOSSES - all troops are unlimited, making this very F2P-friendly.

event_basics.key_mechanic: NO troop losses - troops are unlimited and don't die permanently

veins.description: Mining nodes that generate Orichalcum over time
veins.loot_mechanic: When defeated, veins drop THREE lootable piles of Orichalcum

vein_outbursts.alerts: Banner appears 60 seconds and 10 seconds before spawn
vein_outbursts.priority: CRITICAL - Drop everything and rush these!

smelter.description: Central map objective that opens late

skill_progression.description: Defeat Mine Patrols to earn XP and unlock 5 skill levels. Choose LEFT or RIGHT at each level.

level_5.effect: +50 gathering speed for 60s (5-min CD, manual activation)

skill_progression.skill_5_tip: Save Skill 5 activation for Vein Outbursts ONLY for maximum efficiency!

hunting_approach.name: Hunting Strategy (F2P-Recommended)
hunting_approach.philosophy: Avoid PvP, focus on consistent accumulation
steps: Start on map periphery defeating Mine Patrols
Build up skills through patrol defeats
Prioritize Skill 1 Right (1,500 per patrol)
Save Skill 5 ONLY for Vein Outbursts
Reserve one hero squad for periodic vein occupation
Teleport strategically to find uncontested areas
hunting_approach.pros: Lower risk, consistent rewards, less hero cooldown issues

gathering_approach.name: Gathering Strategy (Competitive)
steps: Rush to high-level veins (Level 2-3)
PRIORITIZE Vein Outbursts above all else
Compete for Smelter control at 7:30 remaining
Engage in PvP to capture occupied veins
Loot scattered piles from defeated veins
gathering_approach.cons: Requires stronger heroes, more PvP exposure

rewards.primary_value: Charm Designs and Charm Guides - key materials for Chief Charm upgrades

top_rank_rewards.1st: 14-Day Blue Flame Avatar, 80 Charm Designs, 50 Charm Guides, 4,000 Gems

common_mistakes.mistake: Neglecting Mine Patrols at the start
common_mistakes.correction: Start with patrols to unlock skills - they multiply your efficiency!
4,000 Orichalcum in 20 seconds! Watch banner alerts, drop everything for these.
Save Skill 5 (+50 speed for 60s) for Vein Outbursts ONLY.
Use free teleport (6-min CD) actively to find uncontested areas.
Always send FULL march - partial marches are easy targets.
Always collect the 3 loot piles from defeated veins - free Orichalcum!
Hero cooldowns hurt gathering. Only PvP when necessary.
Activate pet/item gathering bonuses BEFORE event starts.
Smelter opens at 7:30 remaining - set a timer and rush for it!

during_event: Start by defeating Mine Patrols (skill XP)
Watch for Vein Outbursts at min 8-10 and 18-20
Keep one squad for vein occupation
dont_forget: Loot scattered piles from defeated veins
Heroes cooldown 5 min after defeat - manage carefully
